description: From Middle English certeynly; equivalent to certain +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: certainly (comparative more certainly, superlative most certainly)

entries.meaning: In a way which is certain; with certainty.
examples: he verily thought he had young live frogs in his belly, qui vivebant ex alimento suo, that lived by his nourishment, and was so certainly persuaded of it, that for many years following he could not be rectified in his conceit.
The accident was certainly caused by human error.
That was certainly sweet of him.
You may certainly join us for dinner.

entries.meaning: An emphatic affirmative answer; of course.
examples: Would you like it with ice?  Certainly, and with lemon please.
